results.title: Russia’s Unfounded Claims of Secret U.S. Bioweapons Linger On and On
results.abstract: Without providing evidence, the Kremlin is pressing allegations that the U.S. operates labs in Ukraine and beyond. This week, it has called an investigative session in Geneva.

multimedia.caption: President Vladimir Putin of Russia at a student event last week. The Kremlin accuses the United States of operating secret biological research programs to wreak havoc around the globe.

results.title: How Russia Uses Low Tech in Its High-Tech Weapons
results.abstract: Investigators who examined the electronics in Russia’s newest cruise missiles and attack helicopters were surprised to find decades-old technology reused from earlier models.

results.title: How a Record Cash Haul Vanished for Senate Republicans
results.abstract: The campaign arm of Senate Republicans had collected $181.5 million by the end of July — but spent 95 percent of it. A big investment in digital, and hyperaggressive tactics, have not paid off.

results.title: Seven Days That Closed Out a Career
results.abstract: At the U.S. Open, Serena Williams laughed, rocked sparkly shoes, rang the bell at the stock exchange, beat two opponents, teared up and said goodbye. She didn’t win, but she didn’t lose.

results.title: NASA Calls Off Launch of Artemis Moon Rocket for a 2nd Time
results.abstract: After a pair of called-off launches, the latest caused by a large hydrogen leak, the agency is not expected to try again until later in the month or October.
